title: The Weeknd Announces “After Hours Til Dawn” 2025 Stadium Tour: How to Get Tickets
description: The 33-date North American tour arrives in support of The Weeknd's new album, Hurry Up Tomorrow. Learn how to get pre-sale tickets here. The Weeknd Announces “After Hours Til Dawn” 2025 Stadium Tour: How to Get Tickets Paolo Ragusa
author: Paolo Ragusa
excerpt: The Weeknd has announced his "After Hours Til Dawn" 2025 tour, which will hit stadiums across North America. Learn how to get pre-sale tickets here.
text: On the heels of releasing his sixth studio album Hurry Up Tomorrow, The Weeknd has announced the 2025 “After Hours Til Dawn” tour. The 33-date North American run will hit stadiums throughout the US and Canada from early May to early September, and he’ll be joined by Playboi Carti and Mike Dean as support for each date. Find more details below, including how to get tickets, as well as the full list of The Weeknd’s tour dates. Get The Weeknd Tickets Here Tickets for The Weeknd’s “After Hours Til Dawn” 2025 tour will first be available via an artist pre-sale kicking off on Wednesday, February 5th at 10:00 a.m. local time. There are several other pre-sales offered for The Weeknd’s 2025 tour. A Live Nation pre-sale begins for select dates on Thursday, February 6th at 12:00 p.m. local time (use code OCTAVE). There is also an exclusive pre-sale for Cash App Visa Card customers going down on Thursday, February 6th at 10:00 a.m. local time. Tickets will then on sale to the general public on Friday, February 7th at 10:00 a.m. local time via Ticketmaster. Once tickets are on sale, fans can also look for deals or get tickets to sold-out dates via StubHub, where your purchase is 100% guaranteed through StubHub’s Fan Protect program. StubHub is a secondary market ticketing platform, and prices may be higher or lower than face value, depending on demand. What Is The Weeknd’s 2025 Tour? The Weeknd’s “After Hours Til Dawn” 2025 tour celebrates Hurry Up Tomorrow, The Weeknd’s new album, as well as the conclusion of a trilogy that began with his 2020 album After Hours. He originally launched the “After Hours Til Dawn” tour after the release of 2022’s Dawn F.M., the second installment of the trilogy. The Weeknd (A.K.A. Abel Tesfaye) has hinted that Hurry Up Tomorrow will be his last project under the name The Weeknd, making the “After Hours Til Dawn” run a mini “Eras Tour” for the pop star. The tour kicks off on May 9th in Phoenix and continues sporadically throughout the summer. The Weeknd will play stadiums in Detroit, Chicago, East Rutherford, Minneapolis, Denver, Los Angeles, Las Vegas, Seattle, Vancouver, Montréal, Toronto, Philadelphia, Nashville, Miami, Atlanta, Orlando, Houston, and more; the tour concludes with a September 3rd show at the Alamodome in San Antonio. See the full list of The Weeknd’s tour dates below. Update: Due to overwhelming demand, The Weeknd has added additional shows in Chicago, East Rutherford, Los Angeles, Montreal, and Toronto. The “After Hours Til Dawn” tour was originally meant to be previewed at a special, one-night-only concert at the Rose Bowl in Los Angeles on January 25th, but the show was cancelled due to the California wildfires this month. For the tour, The Weeknd is partnering with Global Citizen, and $1 of every ticket sold will be donated to support children from vulnerable communities around the world. Who Is Opening for The Weeknd on His 2025 Tour? The Weeknd will be joined by Playboi Carti for all dates except the pair of Los Angeles shows on June 25th and 26th, while regular collaborator Mike Dean will open each show. Does The Weeknd Have a New Album Out? Yes, Hurry Up Tomorrow was released on January 31st. It was originally set to be revealed on January 24th, but the album was postponed by one week out of respect for the Los Angeles communities devastated by wildfires. With a nostalgic synth-pop sound akin to his prior two albums, The Weeknd worked on the LP with a sprawling list of producers and collaborators, including Pharrell Williams, Oneohtrixpointenver, Max Martin, Metro Boomin, Justice, Travis Scott, Oscar Holter, Lana Del Rey, and more. Read our review of the album here. He’ll be accompanying the album with an upcoming psychological thriller film, also titled Hurry Up Tomorrow, set for release on May 16th. The Weeknd will star alongside Jenna Ortega and Barry Keoghan, and the film will feature music by Daniel Lopatin (Oneohtrixpointnever) as well as unreleased songs from the making of Hurry Up Tomorrow. It marks The Weeknd’s latest foray into film and television, having previously produced and starred in the maligned HBO show The Idol in 2023. What Are The Weeknd’s 2025 Tour Dates? See The Weeknd’s full list of 2025 tour dates below, and get tickets here. 05/09 — Phoenix, AZ @ State Farm Stadium *@ 05/24 — Detroit, MI @ Ford Field *@ 05/30 — Chicago, IL @ Soldier Field Stadium *@ 05/31 — Chicago, IL @ Soldier Field Stadium *@ 06/05 — East Rutherford, NJ @ MetLife Stadium *@ 06/06 — East Rutherford, NJ @ MetLife Stadium *@ 06/07 — East Rutherford, NJ @ MetLife Stadium *@ 06/10 — Foxborough, MA @ Gillette Stadium *@ 06/14 — Minneapolis, MN @ U.S. Bank Stadium *@ 06/21 — Denver, CO @ Empower Field at Mile High *@ 06/25 — Inglewood, CA @ SoFi Stadium * 06/26 — Inglewood, CA @ SoFi Stadium * 06/28 — Inglewood, CA @ SoFi Stadium * 07/05 — Las Vegas, NV @ Allegiant Stadium *@ 07/08 — Santa Clara, CA @ Levi’s Stadium *@ 07/12 — Seattle, WA @ Lumen Field *@ 07/15 — Vancouver, BC @ BC Place *@ 07/19 — Edmonton, AB @ Commonwealth Stadium *@ 07/24 — Montréal, QC @ Parc Jean Drapeau *@ 07/25 — Montréal, QC @ Parc Jean Drapeau *@ 07/27 — Toronto, ON @ Rogers Centre *@ 07/28 — Toronto, ON @ Rogers Centre *@ 07/30 — Philadelphia, PA @ Lincoln Financial Field *@ 08/02 — Landover, MD @ Northwest Stadium *@ 08/07 — Toronto, ON @ Rogers Centre *@ 08/08 — Toronto, ON @ Rogers Centre *@ 08/12 — Nashville, TN @ Nissan Stadium *@ 08/15 — Miami, FL @ Hard Rock Stadium *@ 08/21 — Atlanta, GA @ Mercedes-Benz Stadium *@ 08/24 — Orlando, FL @ Camping World Stadium *@ 08/27 — Arlington, TX @ AT&T Stadium *@ 08/30 — Houston, TX @ NRG Stadium *@ 09/03 — San Antonio, TX @ Alamodome *@ * = w/ Mike Dean @ = w/ Playboi Carti
html:
On the heels of releasing his sixth studio album Hurry Up Tomorrow, The Weeknd has announced the 2025 “After Hours Til Dawn” tour. The 33-date North American run will hit stadiums throughout the US and Canada from early May to early September, and he’ll be joined by Playboi Carti and Mike Dean as support for each date.

Find more details below, including how to get tickets, as well as the full list of The Weeknd’s tour dates.

Get The Weeknd Tickets Here

Tickets for The Weeknd’s “After Hours Til Dawn” 2025 tour will first be available via an artist pre-sale kicking off on Wednesday, February 5th at 10:00 a.m. local time.

There are several other pre-sales offered for The Weeknd’s 2025 tour. A Live Nation pre-sale begins for select dates on Thursday, February 6th at 12:00 p.m. local time (use code OCTAVE). There is also an exclusive pre-sale for Cash App Visa Card customers going down on Thursday, February 6th at 10:00 a.m. local time.

Tickets will then on sale to the general public on Friday, February 7th at 10:00 a.m. local time via Ticketmaster.

Once tickets are on sale, fans can also look for deals or get tickets to sold-out dates via StubHub, where your purchase is 100% guaranteed through StubHub’s Fan Protect program. StubHub is a secondary market ticketing platform, and prices may be higher or lower than face value, depending on demand.

What Is The Weeknd’s 2025 Tour?

The Weeknd’s “After Hours Til Dawn” 2025 tour celebrates Hurry Up Tomorrow, The Weeknd’s new album, as well as the conclusion of a trilogy that began with his 2020 album After Hours. He originally launched the “After Hours Til Dawn” tour after the release of 2022’s Dawn F.M., the second installment of the trilogy. The Weeknd (A.K.A. Abel Tesfaye) has hinted that Hurry Up Tomorrow will be his last project under the name The Weeknd, making the “After Hours Til Dawn” run a mini “Eras Tour” for the pop star.

The tour kicks off on May 9th in Phoenix and continues sporadically throughout the summer. The Weeknd will play stadiums in Detroit, Chicago, East Rutherford, Minneapolis, Denver, Los Angeles, Las Vegas, Seattle, Vancouver, Montréal, Toronto, Philadelphia, Nashville, Miami, Atlanta, Orlando, Houston, and more; the tour concludes with a September 3rd show at the Alamodome in San Antonio. See the full list of The Weeknd’s tour dates below. Update: Due to overwhelming demand, The Weeknd has added additional shows in Chicago, East Rutherford, Los Angeles, Montreal, and Toronto.

The “After Hours Til Dawn” tour was originally meant to be previewed at a special, one-night-only concert at the Rose Bowl in Los Angeles on January 25th, but the show was cancelled due to the California wildfires this month. For the tour, The Weeknd is partnering with Global Citizen, and $1 of every ticket sold will be donated to support children from vulnerable communities around the world.

Who Is Opening for The Weeknd on His 2025 Tour?

The Weeknd will be joined by Playboi Carti for all dates except the pair of Los Angeles shows on June 25th and 26th, while regular collaborator Mike Dean will open each show.

Does The Weeknd Have a New Album Out?

Yes, Hurry Up Tomorrow was released on January 31st. It was originally set to be revealed on January 24th, but the album was postponed by one week out of respect for the Los Angeles communities devastated by wildfires. With a nostalgic synth-pop sound akin to his prior two albums, The Weeknd worked on the LP with a sprawling list of producers and collaborators, including Pharrell Williams, Oneohtrixpointenver, Max Martin, Metro Boomin, Justice, Travis Scott, Oscar Holter, Lana Del Rey, and more. Read our review of the album here.

He’ll be accompanying the album with an upcoming psychological thriller film, also titled Hurry Up Tomorrow, set for release on May 16th. The Weeknd will star alongside Jenna Ortega and Barry Keoghan, and the film will feature music by Daniel Lopatin (Oneohtrixpointnever) as well as unreleased songs from the making of Hurry Up Tomorrow. It marks The Weeknd’s latest foray into film and television, having previously produced and starred in the maligned HBO show The Idol in 2023.

What Are The Weeknd’s 2025 Tour Dates?

See The Weeknd’s full list of 2025 tour dates below, and get tickets here.
